description: The Windows Server 101 show is meant for those who have little to no experience in managing and maintaining Windows Server.  It fills in the gap for the desktop support technician who wants some basic and practical Window Server Skills, for the IT professional who may work in other areas and want learn more about Windows Server Administration as well as for the A+ and Network+ certified who need the learn just some Window Server Management and Maintenance before they dive into the MCSA to MCSE certification tracks. The goal is introduction and immediate skill development to manage Windows Server.   This is not for the professional who already has years of experience.

It fills in the gap for the desktop support technician who wants some basic and practical Window Server Skills, for the IT professional who may work in other areas and want learn more about Windows Server Administration as well as for the A+ and Network+ certified who need the learn just some Window Server Management and Maintenance before they dive into the MCSA to MCSE certification tracks. The goal is introduction and immediate skill development to manage Windows Server.   This is not for the professional who already has years of experience.
name: Windows Server 101
subtitle: Introduction to Windows Server

episodes.description: The Windows Server 101 show is meant for those who have little to no experience in managing and maintaining Windows Server. It fills in the gap for the desktop support technician who wants some basic and practical Window Server Skills, for the IT professional who may work in other areas and want learn more about Windows Server Administration as well as for the A+ and Network+ certified who need the learn just some Window Server Management and Maintenance before they dive into the MCSA to MCSE certification tracks. The goal is introduction and immediate skill development to manage Windows Server. This is not for the professional who already has years of experience. The ebook can be downloaded here https://itprotv-notes-bucket.s3.amazonaws.com/Windows_Server_101_by_Brian_Svidergol.pdf
episodes.title: Overview
episodes.transcript:
WEBVTT

1
00:00:00.025 --> 00:00:05.672
[MUSIC]

2
00:00:05.672 --> 00:00:07.433
Welcome to ITProTV.

3
00:00:07.433 --> 00:00:11.964
I'm here to introduce to you a new
show that we're producing on

4
00:00:11.964 --> 00:00:13.767
Windows Server 101.

5
00:00:13.767 --> 00:00:17.045
Now if you're wondering,
what the heck is Windows Server 101 about?

6
00:00:17.045 --> 00:00:18.052
That's a great question.

7
00:00:18.052 --> 00:00:22.156
What we found out is that there is a
knowledge gap that you may have if you've

8
00:00:22.156 --> 00:00:24.590
just come from studying A+ and Network+.

9
00:00:24.590 --> 00:00:27.752
And say, hey,
I'm about to jump into the MCSA track.

10
00:00:27.752 --> 00:00:30.204
But then you feel
a little bit overwhelmed,

11
00:00:30.204 --> 00:00:34.790
because there is a ton of knowledge
right there inside of that MCSA track.

12
00:00:34.790 --> 00:00:39.185
Well, this is going to fill in that gap of
the server knowledge that you'll need as

13
00:00:39.185 --> 00:00:40.660
you go in to that training.

14
00:00:40.660 --> 00:00:43.975
Also, you may be doing
desktop support right now in

15
00:00:43.975 --> 00:00:47.860
which you haven't had any
real server experience.

16
00:00:47.860 --> 00:00:51.368
This show will at least help you get
settled and started, and feeling

17
00:00:51.368 --> 00:00:55.556
comfortable in that server knowledge, and
provide you the skills that you need.

18
00:00:55.556 --> 00:01:00.413
Now this particular show is going to
be produced around a book by one of

19
00:01:00.413 --> 00:01:04.880
our subject matters that we had
come in called Brian Sviderol.

20
00:01:04.880 --> 00:01:07.266
Brian Svidergol wrote a book
called Windows Server 101.

21
00:01:07.266 --> 00:01:10.500
Let me show you what I'm
talking about right here.

22
00:01:10.500 --> 00:01:13.938
So here on my screen, it is an e-book and

23
00:01:13.938 --> 00:01:17.489
the great thing is it will be free for
you.

24
00:01:17.489 --> 00:01:20.476
So, Brian has actually released
this out into the public.

25
00:01:20.476 --> 00:01:25.413
And here at ITProTV, we've obtained
permission to also produce a show

26
00:01:25.413 --> 00:01:30.620
giving the content or surrounding
the content of this book as well.

27
00:01:30.620 --> 00:01:33.667
And you'll actually see
right here in his abstract,

28
00:01:33.667 --> 00:01:38.610
aimed as an introduction to Windows Server
provides an overview of administration and

29
00:01:38.610 --> 00:01:43.487
management for Windows Server operating
system without any prerequisite knowledge

30
00:01:43.487 --> 00:01:46.830
of Windows Server is necessary and
that is the whole goal.

31
00:01:46.830 --> 00:01:51.212
So if you are actually saying,
I need to learn more about Windows Server,

32
00:01:51.212 --> 00:01:52.708
this is the show for you.

33
00:01:52.708 --> 00:01:54.839
If you're getting ready
to take the MCSA or

34
00:01:54.839 --> 00:01:58.033
to take that track on, well,
this is the show for you as well that

35
00:01:58.033 --> 00:02:02.520
we'll get you comfortable with the
knowledge and the material that you need.

36
00:02:02.520 --> 00:02:07.910
Now, this particular show though is not
based around any particular exam at all.

37
00:02:07.910 --> 00:02:10.428
So, there are no real
objectives that are met.

38
00:02:10.428 --> 00:02:11.616
Here at ITProTV,

39
00:02:11.616 --> 00:02:16.960
we wanted to make sure that we gave you
the best possible chance at exceeding.

40
00:02:16.960 --> 00:02:22.140
And of course, succeeding on
your MCSA skills as you move on.

41
00:02:22.140 --> 00:02:24.640
So, what are some of the things
that we'll be covering?

42
00:02:24.640 --> 00:02:28.719
Well, Brian's book is actually divided
up into five different parts and

43
00:02:28.719 --> 00:02:31.970
there's actually 24
different chapters in it.

44
00:02:31.970 --> 00:02:35.614
We tried to actually produce,
well, either a single a show or

45
00:02:35.614 --> 00:02:39.970
multiple shows around those particular
chapters that will help you out.

46
00:02:39.970 --> 00:02:44.325
So what you'll actually see in this
particular show that's coming up is that

47
00:02:44.325 --> 00:02:48.613
you'll see different episodes based
on just basic server fundamentals and

48
00:02:48.613 --> 00:02:52.298
this is where we get you familiar
with Windows Server itself, and

49
00:02:52.298 --> 00:02:55.380
understanding the functions,
and the features, and

50
00:02:55.380 --> 00:02:59.600
how to do a few things that you
may not have actually done before.

51
00:02:59.600 --> 00:03:03.913
You're also of course, going to see the
idea of networking components that we find

52
00:03:03.913 --> 00:03:07.750
in Windows Server itself and we'll
talk about some of the details there.

53
00:03:07.750 --> 00:03:08.543
And o course,

54
00:03:08.543 --> 00:03:12.843
your basic Network+ knowledge is going
to be of tremendous help for you as you

55
00:03:12.843 --> 00:03:18.160
continue to go through those particular
sections that we'll cover in there.

56
00:03:18.160 --> 00:03:21.530
Then we'll expose you to
the basics of Active Directory,

57
00:03:21.530 --> 00:03:24.644
directory services as well
along with group policy.

58
00:03:24.644 --> 00:03:28.180
And we'll talk about managing user
accounts and computer accounts.

59
00:03:28.180 --> 00:03:32.784
We'll even see the use of group policy and
how we actually apply them, and

60
00:03:32.784 --> 00:03:38.240
where to apply the as well as getting
everything set up for what we need to do.

61
00:03:38.240 --> 00:03:39.650
We'll also see in the fourth part.

62
00:03:39.650 --> 00:03:44.760
We'll see services covered storage
as well as NTFS permissions.

63
00:03:44.760 --> 00:03:49.054
One of the big topics that you'll see that
will be throughout everything that you'll

64
00:03:49.054 --> 00:03:52.108
do in your MCSA or MCSE track
as you continue to move forward.

65
00:03:52.108 --> 00:03:54.606
So make sure you do take a look at those,
as well.

66
00:03:54.606 --> 00:03:57.414
And then finally, our last section,

67
00:03:57.414 --> 00:04:02.590
we'll be covering file services
as well as print services.

68
00:04:02.590 --> 00:04:08.063
Now once you actually have that and
everything is good, that will give

69
00:04:08.063 --> 00:04:13.905
you a solid foundation for, of course,
you to proceed on to well deeper and

70
00:04:13.905 --> 00:04:18.670
more advanced topics that you'll
see inside MCSA and MCSE.

71
00:04:18.670 --> 00:04:23.950
So, this will give you at least a broad
breadth of knowledge to help you do so.

72
00:04:23.950 --> 00:04:27.889
Now for you to obtain Brian's e-book,
you can go out there and

73
00:04:27.889 --> 00:04:29.462
search on the internet.

74
00:04:29.462 --> 00:04:36.538
Use your favorite browser engine, type in
Brian Sviderol's name, S-V-I-D-E-R-O-L.

75
00:04:36.538 --> 00:04:40.634
I know it's kind of a long name to spell
out there, but you can actually type in

76
00:04:40.634 --> 00:04:45.370
Windows Server 101 and you'll probably
see that there'll be a link there.

77
00:04:45.370 --> 00:04:50.236
Now if you're actually an ITProTV member
though, you'll also see a link directly to

78
00:04:50.236 --> 00:04:54.831
this particular overview video as well and
that will also give you that access and

79
00:04:54.831 --> 00:04:57.618
that chance to be able to
download that book too.

80
00:04:57.618 --> 00:04:59.982
Now, this is not a light book.

81
00:04:59.982 --> 00:05:07.300
So even as an overview, it is,
electronically about 353 pages.

82
00:05:07.300 --> 00:05:09.890
So, you plus or minus about 50 pages for

83
00:05:09.890 --> 00:05:13.160
table of contents and
then some indexing at the end.

84
00:05:13.160 --> 00:05:16.250
But overall though,
it's still about 300 pages.

85
00:05:16.250 --> 00:05:17.989
So, it is a great book.

86
00:05:17.989 --> 00:05:20.220
It's a great base of knowledge.

87
00:05:20.220 --> 00:05:24.423
Combine that along with your own study
skills, along with the labs that you can

88
00:05:24.423 --> 00:05:28.768
actually follow in Brian's book as well
as labs that we present here at ITProTV.

89
00:05:28.768 --> 00:05:33.467
It will get you prepared for
what you need in Windows Server knowledge.

90
00:05:33.467 --> 00:05:36.643
So if you're ready to proceed,
make sure you stay tuned for

91
00:05:36.643 --> 00:05:38.940
the first video following this overview.

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Cherokee brief talk about purpose of this show. The team discuss the basic premise of Windows Server and it’s use and setup for a Windows Server Environment.  They dive into some of the hardware considerations we should understand and know as a Server Administrator.  Cherokee also shows the beginning of installation and the choices you must make before the installation completes.  Lastly, she reviews the minimum hardware requirement for getting the installation of Window Server completed.
episodes.title: A Peek into Windows

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Cherokee take a look at the software side of Windows Server.  The break down of the operating system is described by Cherokee.   The team briefly differentiates between physical and virtual servers as well as workgroups vs. domains..   Cherokee introduces the basics of how Window Server is secured.  They discuss briefly the nature of Windows Server in the cloud.  Lastly, Cherokee previews some of the other networking topics Server Admins will need to be familiar with as they work with Windows Servers.
episodes.title: A Peek into Windows Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Cherokee introduce the Server Manager in Windows Server.  Cherokee shows what the Server Manager help the System Admin to do for the local computer and multiple computers.  She takes the time to explore the different elements and mention why it’s an important part of the Sys Admin’s management to use.  She demonstrates creating a group and showing some of the different elements can be managed from using the Server Manager.
episodes.title: Introduction to Server Manager

episodes.description: In this show, Ronnie and Cherokee embrace the pervasive command based management tool called PowerShell. Ronnie explains the syntax verb noun structure and offers several examples to set the tone and familiarize the layout of commands and commandlets. He also demonstrates how to query and filter queries. Lastly, you will learn various symbols and the ways in which they aid PowerShell navigation.
episodes.title: Get Started with PowerShell

episodes.description: In this show, Ronnie and Cherokee continue to discuss PowerShell. Specifically, they explain what type of administrative functions can be executed to make work more efficient. Ronnie demonstrates how to verify Hotfix installs, troubleshoot network connectivity and invoke history all thru PowerShell.
episodes.title: Get Started with PowerShell Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Cherokee demonstrate how to add server roles and features in Windows Server.  They discuss what a server role is and what must be done to install the role  using the GUI and PowerShell.  Cherokee demonstrates the installation of 2 separate roles and then how to uninstall an installed role.  They emphasize the best practice of only installing the services and features needed and not haphazardly installing every role and feature available.
episodes.title: Adding Server Roles and Features

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Cherokee dive into reviewing the networking fundamentals.  Cherokee reviews the quick history of networking and an overview of subnetting basics.  She provides a scenario on where we would use subnetting and a practical application  of it when creating DHCP scopes.  Lastly, she gives a few minutes providing some review of port number and how they are used.
episodes.title: Networking Fundamentals

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Cherokee continue with additional the networking fundamentals.  Cherokee demonstrates how to provide some networking redundancy and even performance using the NIC teaming.  She distinguishes the 2 type of NIC Teaming used and demonstrates how to configure the independent mode.  She also reviews some of the technology used to help secure the networking communications between the server and other devices.
episodes.title: Networking Fundamentals Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Cherokee take us through configuring the DHCP server for use.  Cherokee shows how to setup a scope and scope options.  She explains each step and the shows the end result of the setup.  She explains that even though configured, it may not be ready for use until the server is authorized in your domain environment.  She discusses with Ronnie the use of dynamic IPs and configures reserved IPs within the DHCP scope.  Lastly, she shows how to backup and restore the DHCP database through the GUI.
episodes.title: Managing a DHCP Server Role

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Cherokee show configuring the DHCP server role using powershell.  Cherokee shows how to create a scope with scope options and a scope reservation here.  The team emphasizes the goal of using powershell to automate multiple scope, option and reservation creations.  They demonstrate also some simple powershell commands to also show the DHCP utilization too.
episodes.title: Managing a DHCP Server Role Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Cherokee introduce managing client name resolution.  Cherokee mentions the different types of name resolution available to Windows Clients: DNS, HOSTS and LMHOSTS files and WINS.  She turns her attention onto describing form and function of the FQDN, Fully Qualified Domain Name and the DNS resolution process from the client. Lastly, she demonstrates of the powershell and command line utilities can be used to discover DNC functionality for a client computer.
episodes.title: Managing Client Name Resolution

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Cherokee continue with client name resolution.  Cherokee emphasizes the importance of isolating where the DNS issue is occurring: locally or on the server.  She uses and discusses different tools to aid in troubleshooting DNS on the client.
episodes.title: Managing Client Name Resolution Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Cherokee take a look at skills resolving around the DNS Server Role on Windows Server.  Cherokee takes the time to guide through the different properties on 8 different tabs.  She also shows how to stop and restart the DNS Server as well as the use of the Server Cache and describes forwarders and conditional forwarding.  Cherokee describes some of the different resource records that Server Admins should become familiar with in the day to day operations of DNS.  Lastly, she describes the use of Round Robin DNS.
episodes.title: Managing the DNS Server Role

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Cherokee continue with the DNS Server management first by demonstrating the default round robin configuration of DNS.  Cherokee also goes on to describe the use of scavenging and shows how to identify the timestamp and TTL used in the process.  She also demonstrates the ability to force scavenging to occur too.
episodes.title: Managing the DNS Server Role Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Cherokee show how to create and work with standard DNS zones.  Cherokee explains the use of the Primary Zones and Secondary Zones.  She also creates them through the DNS Console.  She explains also how the secondary DNS zone gets its zone transfer and the differences between full zone transfers and incremental zone transfers.
episodes.title: Working with DNS Zones

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Cherokee continue working with 2 additional zone types:  Stub Zones and Active-Directory integrated zones.  These types of zones are more prevalent in a Windows Active Directory Environment, according to Cherokee.  She also discusses the different benefits of using these zone types that include replication, secure updates  and dynamic management.
episodes.title: Working with DNS Zones Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Cherokee show some of the basic network troubleshooting utilities that Server Admins should be familiar with in a domain environment.  Cherokee shows some of the different options with ping to get results.  These can be used to to determine the latency, round trip time and connectivity.  Even though this works very effectively, it is limited in options compared to test-connection—a powershell cmdlet, according to Cherokee.
episodes.title: Troubleshooting Network Connections

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Cherokee continue with some additional tools like ipconfig, get-netipconfiguration, tracert, pathping, arp and nslookup.  Cherokee shows the basic information found from ipconfig and compares it with powershell cmdlet ‘get-netipconfiguration’.  She also uses tracert and compares the output to pathping.  Lastly, she uses arp and nslookup to review some layer 2 and layer 3 issues.
episodes.title: Troubleshooting Network Connections Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Cherokee wrap troubleshooting networking connections by take a look at a couple of additional command line based utilities:  Netstat and telnet.  Cherokee shows multiple options with Netstat to demonstrate the different results can be seen with it.  As a live statistical tool, it allows us to verify many things including the ports that are connecting or connected and other information.  She also uses telnet to demonstrate TCP connections are working.  Though primary used a tool for remote access, it can be used to test a connection to specific port to see if it’s up and connected too, according to the team.  She also demonstrates powerhshell cmdlet test-netconnection.
episodes.title: Troubleshooting Network Connections Part 3

episodes.description: In this show, Cherokee and Ronnie begin a discussion surrounding Active Directory.  Ronnie explains the structure of an Active Directory environment and the terms used to describe the components. Ronnie demonstrates how to configure Remote Management to run commands on a remote server. Ronnie also demonstrates how create a customized Microsoft Management Console (MMC).
episodes.title: Active Directory Basic Administration

episodes.description: In this show, Cherokee and Ronnie begin discussing Organizational Units (OU's).  Ronnie explains why OU's should be used. He also shows how to create, manage and delete one.
episodes.title: Active Directory Basic Administration Part 2

episodes.description: One of the most common tasks to perform in Active Directory is the creation of user accounts. Ronnie and Cherokee demonstrate the different ways you can create users and the options you can include for that object.  First Ronnie shows how to create one user then he  shows what it takes to create several users at once.
episodes.title: Create User Accounts

episodes.description: In this show Cherokee and Ronnie continue to examine Active Directory user accounts. Depending on the task one may choose to ADUC, PowerShell or additional tools such as a CSV file to create, modify or delete objects. Ronnie shows while it may be cumbersome to type a long string of PowerShell syntax it will help save time in the long run.
episodes.title: Create User Accounts Part 2

episodes.description: In this show, Cherokee and Ronnie tackle some of the most common administrative duties one may encounter whilst working within Active Directory. The discuss some best practices that should be considered followed by Ronnie demonstrating how to configure the in both the GUI and via PowerShell. Tune in to learn how to set passwords, expiration options, unlock accounts and manage stale accounts.
episodes.title: Managing User Accounts

episodes.description: In this show, Ronnie and Cherokee explain how to manage computer accounts. They look at two different ways of doing so. First, they explain that computer accounts by default are created when a computer joins a domain or created manually when pre-staging an account before it is joined to a domain. They also show different ways to accomplish these tasks both in the GUI as well as PowerShell.
episodes.title: Manage AD Computer Accounts

episodes.description: In this show, Ronnie and Cherokee continue to look at how manage computer accounts. Ronnie shows two different methods to create computer accounts. First, he shows how computers accounts are generated when the computer joins a domain followed by pre-staging the computer account. Ronnie explains the benefits of creating pre-staged accounts as in addition to the various methods to get the job done.
episodes.title: Managing AD Computer Accounts Part 2

episodes.description: Ronnie and Zach discuss what is a 'Group,' what are group managing tasks, how to access groups, regular duties for the server administrator, managing groups, group types, what is a 'Forest,' and permissions.
episodes.title: Managing Groups

episodes.description: Ronnie and Zach continue discussing managing groups beginning in this episode with what default groups are, different types of default groups we should be familiar with, how to add members to a group using ADUC & ADAC & Powershell, and how to remove members from using ADUC & ADAC & Powershell.
episodes.title: Managing Groups Part 2

episodes.description: Ronnie and Zach discuss what a group policy is, common group policy management tasks, configuration management, built-in management technology, domain based vs. local group policy, when to use domain based & local group policy, create a GPO, and using GPMC to create a GPO.
episodes.title: Working with Group Policy

episodes.description: In this show, Ronnie and Cherokee introduce Group Policy. First, Ronnie explains the differences between Policies and Preferences and why one may choose one setting over the other. They also speak about inheritance and ways in which inheritance can be blocked. Lastly, Ronnie cover link order to set policy priority.
episodes.title: Working with Group Policy Part 2

episodes.description: In this show, Cherokee and Ronnie introduce the idea of implementing security with via group policy. First, Ronnie walks us through six different policy setting and explains how each one can be used. They continue their conversation but take an unusual twist to explain a a non-group policy settings called fine-grained password and account lockout policies.
episodes.title: Securing Server with Group Policy

episodes.description: This episode picks up from the previous the conversation where Cherokee and Ronnie discuss implementing password policies. First, they delve deeper within fine-grained password policies via group policy management console (GPMC).
episodes.title: Securing Server with Group Policy Part 2

episodes.description: In this show Ronnie and Cherokee continue to discuss how group policy can secure servers. They show how Windows Firewall can be incorporated to apply and manage rules.
episodes.title: Securing Server with Group Policy Part 3

episodes.description: In this show, Cherokee and Ronnie explain what services are and how managing them correctly can improve system and network performance. Ronnie demonstrates how to navigate through the services management console using services.msc, the primary management tool. He also demonstrates other ways to start and stop a service through the GUI and PowerShell.
episodes.title: Managing Windows Services

episodes.description: In this show, Cherokee and Ronnie continue to discuss ways to manage services. First, Ronnie explains the purpose of a service account, which accounts one should use and explains issues you may encounter. Next, they look at group managed service accounts and describe ways to work across multiple servers, schedule tasks, and provide application support.
episodes.title: Managing Windows Services Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Cherokee introduce working with local storage.  Cherokee reviews of the basic storage and terminology concepts.  She reviews basic disk redundancy and performance technology like RAID, 0, 1, and 5.  She distinguishes partitioning technology of MBR and GPT.
episodes.title: Working with Local Storage

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Cherokee continue with storage concepts.  Cherokee distinguishes between Volumes and Partitions.  She demonstrates how to create volumes using the Disk Management utility built into the Windows Server Environment.
episodes.title: Working with Local Storage Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Cherokee continue working with local storage.  They show how to configure multiple hard drives for usage in storage spaces.  This is another way to dynamically manage and configure storage within the Windows Server OS.  Cherokee demonstrates how to configure multiple options for storage space depending on the demands.  The team emphasize the ease and use of this technology when working with local storage.
episodes.title: Working with Local Storage Part 3

episodes.description: In this show, Cherokee and Ronnie explain how NTFS permissions can be used on a system running an NTFS file system. Ronnie shows the default standard permission setting options and suggests avoiding the deny option whenever possible.
episodes.title: Managing NTFS Permissions

episodes.description: In this show, Ronnie and Cherokee continue talking about NTFS permissions. First, they look at a more tailored  approach to configure permissions using the advanced option. Ronnie also demonstrates how to change ownership, encrypt files and folders, as well as implementing auditing.
episodes.title: Managing NTFS Permissions Part 2

episodes.description: In this show, Ronnie and Cherokee explain how to manage access control across shared folders and files. First, they explain how share permissions affect NTFS permissions and even advise against combining the two. They discuss the purpose of hidden shares and demonstrate how to create one.
episodes.title: Managing Shared Folders and Files

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Ronnie continue to discuss shared folders and files.  first, they discuss Access-Based Enumeration (ABE) a way to implement the principle of least privilege and only display folders and files to which the user has been granted permission. They also look at how to enable shadow copies to store multiple versions of a folder or file. Lastly, they look at File Server Resource Manager as a way to implement quotas, screen files and generate reports.
episodes.title: Managing Shared Folders and Files Part 2

episodes.description: In this show, Ronnie and Cherokee look at utilizing print services. They discuss and demonstrate how to provide correct drivers for end users in an environment. They also Look at management functions such as managing print permissions and managing print queues.
episodes.title: Managing Print Services

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Ronnie continue to discuss Print Services. Specifically, the look at why and how to configure printer pooling. Don't miss the import considerations to keep in mind for your printer pooling design.
episodes.title: Managing Print Services Part 2
